      25                 :            : /*!
      26                 :            :  * Function to calculate the normal vector computation error.Error is defined as sum over the map of absolute cosines
      27                 :            :  * between analytical and computed normals. The cosines are calculated using the dot product between two unitary vectors.
      28                 :            :  * The error sum is then averaged between the latest 20 iteration of the functions.
      29                 :            :  *
      30                 :            :  * @param map: grid map to which add the layers that contains the errors.
      31                 :            :  * @param gridMapSize: Dimensions of grid map, passed as parameter to not being calculated every time.
      32                 :            :  * @param directionalErrorAreaSum: Average of the summed error over the map for area method.
      33                 :            :  * @param directionalErrorRasterSum: Average of the summed error over the map for raster method.
      34                 :            :  */
      35                 :            : void normalsErrorCalculation(
      36                 :            :   grid_map::GridMap & map, const grid_map::Size & gridMapSize, double & directionalErrorAreaSum,
      37                 :            :   double & directionalErrorRasterSum);
      38                 :            : 
      39                 :            : /*!
      40                 :            :  * Function to add noise to the elevation map. Noise added is white noise from a uniform distribution [-1:1] multiplied by
      41                 :            :  * the amount of noise wanted specified by noise_on_map.
      42                 :            :  *
      43                 :            :  * @param map: grid map to which add the layers that contains the errors.
      44                 :            :  * @param gridMapSize: Dimensions of grid map, passed as parameter to not being calculated every time.
      45                 :            :  * @param noise_on_map: Amount of noise wanted in meters, can be set as an argument in the roslaunch phase.
      46                 :            :  */
      47                 :            : void mapAddNoise(
      48                 :            :   grid_map::GridMap & map, const grid_map::Size & gridMapSize,

      50                 :            : 
      51                 :            : /*!

      55                 :            :  * @param map: grid map to which add the layers that contains the errors.

     218                 :          0 : void normalsErrorCalculation(
     219                 :            :   grid_map::GridMap & map, const grid_map::Size & gridMapSize, double & directionalErrorAreaSum,
     220                 :            :   double & directionalErrorRasterSum)
     221                 :            : {
     222                 :            :   // If layers saved as matrices accessing values is faster.
     223                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Matrix mapNormalAnalyticX = map["normal_analytic_x"];
     224                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Matrix mapNormalAnalyticY = map["normal_analytic_y"];
     225                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Matrix mapNormalAnalyticZ = map["normal_analytic_z"];
     226                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Matrix mapNormalAreaX = map["normal_area_x"];
     227                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Matrix mapNormalAreaY = map["normal_area_y"];
     228                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Matrix mapNormalAreaZ = map["normal_area_z"];
     229                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Matrix mapNormalRasterX = map["normal_raster_x"];
     230                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Matrix mapNormalRasterY = map["normal_raster_y"];
     231                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Matrix mapNormalRasterZ = map["normal_raster_z"];
     232                 :            : 
     233                 :            :   // Initialize vector to use eigen scalar product (Vector3 = Eigen::Vector3d).
     234                 :            :   grid_map::Vector3 normalVectorAnalytic = Vector3::Zero();
     235                 :            :   grid_map::Vector3 normalVectorArea = Vector3::Zero();
     236                 :            :   grid_map::Vector3 normalVectorRaster = Vector3::Zero();
     237                 :            : 
     238                 :            :   // Add layer for possible future visualization in RViz to understand where error is.
     239                 :          0 :   map.add("directionalErrorArea", grid_map::Matrix::Zero(gridMapSize(0), gridMapSize(1)));
     240                 :          0 :   map.add("directionalErrorRaster", grid_map::Matrix::Zero(gridMapSize(0), gridMapSize(1)));
     241                 :            : 
     242                 :            :   // Raster normals not defined for outermost layer of cells.
     243                 :            :   const grid_map::Index submapStartIndex(1, 1);
     244                 :          0 :   const grid_map::Index submapBufferSize(gridMapSize(0) - 2, gridMapSize(1) - 2);
     245                 :          0 :   for (grid_map::SubmapIterator iterator(map, submapStartIndex, submapBufferSize);
     246                 :          0 :     !iterator.isPastEnd(); ++iterator)
     247                 :            :   {
     248                 :          0 :     const grid_map::Index index(*iterator);
     249                 :            : 
     250                 :          0 :     normalVectorAnalytic(0) = mapNormalAnalyticX(index(0), index(1));
     251                 :          0 :     normalVectorAnalytic(1) = mapNormalAnalyticY(index(0), index(1));
     252                 :          0 :     normalVectorAnalytic(2) = mapNormalAnalyticZ(index(0), index(1));
     253                 :            : 
     254                 :          0 :     normalVectorArea(0) = mapNormalAreaX(index(0), index(1));
     255                 :          0 :     normalVectorArea(1) = mapNormalAreaY(index(0), index(1));
     256                 :          0 :     normalVectorArea(2) = mapNormalAreaZ(index(0), index(1));
     257                 :            : 
     258                 :          0 :     normalVectorRaster(0) = mapNormalRasterX(index(0), index(1));
     259                 :          0 :     normalVectorRaster(1) = mapNormalRasterY(index(0), index(1));
     260                 :          0 :     normalVectorRaster(2) = mapNormalRasterZ(index(0), index(1));
     261                 :            : 
     262                 :            :     // Error(alpha) = 1.0 - abs(cos(alpha)),
     263                 :            :     // where alpha = angle(normalVectorAnalytic, normalVectorArea)
     264                 :            :     // Error of perfect normals will be 0.0.
     265                 :            :     map.at(
     266                 :            :       "directionalErrorArea",
     267                 :          0 :       *iterator) = 1.0 - std::abs(normalVectorAnalytic.dot(normalVectorArea));
     268                 :            :     map.at(
     269                 :            :       "directionalErrorRaster",
     270                 :          0 :       *iterator) = 1.0 - std::abs(normalVectorAnalytic.dot(normalVectorRaster));
     271                 :            :   }
     272                 :            : 
     273                 :            :   // Directional error defined as sum of
     274                 :            :   // absolute cosines of normal calculated with different methods
     275                 :          0 :   const double directionalErrorArea = map["directionalErrorArea"].array().sum();
     276                 :          0 :   const double directionalErrorRaster = map["directionalErrorRaster"].array().sum();
     277                 :            : 
     278                 :            :   // Calculate mean value of directional error of last 20 cycles.
     279                 :          0 :   directionalErrorAreaSum = (directionalErrorAreaSum * 19.0 + directionalErrorArea) / 20.0;
     280                 :          0 :   directionalErrorRasterSum = (directionalErrorRasterSum * 19.0 + directionalErrorRaster) / 20.0;
     281                 :          0 : }

     292                 :          0 : void mapAddOutliers(

     298                 :            : 
     299                 :          0 :   for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(numberInfPoints); ++i) {
     300                 :            :     grid_map::Position randomPosition = grid_map::Position::Random();
     301                 :          0 :     if (map.isInside(randomPosition)) {
     302                 :          0 :       map.atPosition("elevation_noisy", randomPosition) = std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
     303                 :            :     }
     304                 :            :   }
     305                 :          0 : }

     307                 :          0 : void mapAverageFiltering(
     308                 :            :   grid_map::GridMap & map, const grid_map::Size & gridMapSize,
     309                 :            :   const double filterRadius)
     310                 :            : {
     311                 :            :   grid_map::Index startIndex(0, 0);
     312                 :          0 :   grid_map::SubmapIterator it(map, startIndex, gridMapSize);
     313                 :            :   // Iterate over whole map.
     314                 :          0 :   for (; !it.isPastEnd(); ++it) {
     315                 :            :     Position currentPosition;
     316                 :          0 :     map.getPosition(*it, currentPosition);
     317                 :            :     double mean = 0.0;
     318                 :            :     double sumOfWeights = 0.0;
     319                 :            : 
     320                 :            :     // Compute weighted mean.
     321                 :          0 :     for (grid_map::CircleIterator circleIt(map, currentPosition, filterRadius);
     322                 :          0 :       !circleIt.isPastEnd(); ++circleIt)
     323                 :            :     {
     324                 :          0 :       if (!map.isValid(*circleIt, "elevation_noisy")) {
     325                 :          0 :         continue;
     326                 :            :       }
     327                 :            :       grid_map::Position currentPositionInCircle;
     328                 :          0 :       map.getPosition(*circleIt, currentPositionInCircle);
     329                 :            : 
     330                 :            :       // Computed weighted mean based on Euclidian distance.
     331                 :            :       double distance = (currentPosition - currentPositionInCircle).norm();
     332                 :          0 :       double weight = pow(filterRadius - distance, 2);
     333                 :          0 :       mean += weight * map.at("elevation_noisy", *circleIt);
     334                 :          0 :       sumOfWeights += weight;
     335                 :            :     }
     336                 :          0 :     if (sumOfWeights != 0) {
     337                 :          0 :       map.at("elevation_filtered", *it) = mean / sumOfWeights;
     338                 :            :     } else {
     339                 :          0 :       map.at("elevation_filtered", *it) = std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity();
     340                 :            :     }
     341                 :            :   }
     342                 :          0 : }
     343                 :            : }  // namespace grid_map
